meanings.sent1: The passengers emplaned the plane for their vacation.
meanings.sent2: We emplaned the flight to visit our relatives.
meanings.sent3: The family emplaned the aircraft, excited for their trip.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, they emplaned the plane, ready for adventure.
meanings.sent5: The children eagerly emplaned the airplane, eager to see new sights.

meanings.definition: To put on board an airplane.
meanings.sent1: The crew emplaned the cargo carefully before takeoff.
meanings.sent2: They emplaned the supplies for the remote village.
meanings.sent3: The workers emplaned the equipment, making sure everything was secure.
meanings.sent4: The team emplaned the tools, ready for the construction project.
meanings.sent5: The staff efficiently emplaned the goods onto the aircraft.
